results.title: The Invisible ghost
results.creator_credit: Sam Katzman, Monogram Pictures Corporation, Banner Productions and Joseph Lewis
results.brief_description: Bela Lugosi stars as Mr. Charles Kessler in this bizarre, noirish tale of murder and mystery. Every year on the anniversary of his failed marriage, Mr. Kessler conducts dinner with his estranged wife’s ghost within the claustrophobic confines of the house they once shared. The mysterious death of the new housemaid barely creates a disturbance due to the frequency of murders that have occurred in the house in recent months. Mr. Kessler, his daughter Virginia, and Evans the butler struggle to maintain calm as the body count escalates, and the police search for clues to the latest killings. As all the clues begin to add up it seems that the killer may be closer to home than first suspected, and that an evil force reaching beyond the grave may also be to blame. Features some unusual camera work and a fine performance from Lugosi.

results.title: The Invisible force
results.creator_credit: Michael Latham, Christopher Haws and Landmark Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Start Here: Adventures into Science”.
Konrad, the kitchen robot, shows students that gravity and friction determine how everything on earth behaves during movement. Using simple experiments that can be reproduced in class or at home, he reveals the nature of the forces acting upon us.

results.title: The Invisible enemy
results.creator_credit: Norman Swallow, BBC-TV and World Health Organisation
results.brief_description: A survey of the more important virus diseases and the efforts of WHO and other authorities to overcome them: foot and mouth disease; polio - why it is apparently a disease of advanced countries - and the Salk vaccine; yellow fever, and a question: “Can it be kept out of Asia?”; the difficulties of preventing influenza by vaccination; the importance of quarantine and other control measures at ports and airports. Narrated by James McKechnie.

results.title: The Invisible disability: hearing impairment
results.creator_credit: Des Pickering, Alan Foley and Burwood State College Special Education Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Victoria College Special Education Films”.
Hearing impairment is a common disability amongst the community and this documentary aims to make people more aware of this disability. The causes of deafness are discussed and the program stresses the importance of early detection, as language and speech development are seriously affected if help is delayed. Children and parents discuss their problems with communication. Narrated by Barry McQueen.

results.title: The Invisible children (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America, Rift Fournier and Christopher Brough
results.brief_description: Presents the Kids on the Block, a unique group of puppets in that one is deaf, one blind and another in a wheelchair. They tour the country encouraging non-disabled children to ask and learn about their handicapped peers and to see the world through different eyes. Stars Gary Burghoff (from TV’s MASH) and was made during an actual classroom presentation. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Invisible boy
results.creator_credit: Elaine Sperber, Highgate Pictures and Mark Cullingham
results.brief_description: Charlie visits his unconventional mountain-dwelling aunt and can’t wait to get home. To keep him with her the aunt tells Charlie she can make him invisible and by pretending not to see him, her spell has seemingly worked. However when Charlie still wants to go home, the aunt creates another kind of invisible boy. Based on the short story by Ray Bradbury. Starring Christian Slater and Kate Reid. Suitable for upper primary and lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: The Invincibles
results.brief_description: In 1948, seventeen Australian cricketers set sail for England, their country’s dreams for defending the Ashes riding on their shoulders. It had been a long time between drinks for the Australians, ten years had passed, and the war weary Britons were looking forward to the restoration of national tradition, and the appearance of the Australian team led by one of the greatest batsmen of the day, Don Bradman. Remarkably, the team played six days a week for five months and did not lose a single match, thus earning the reputation, “the invincibles”. Players such as Bradman, Hassett, Barnes, Morris, Harvey, Lindwall and Miller provided a victory that became part of Australian cricket history. ABC Television producer Lincoln Tyner, with the assistance of respected cricket writer and author, Mike Coward, have in this documentary recorded interviews with surviving members of the famous team, the only side in the long history of rivalry between Australia and England, to go through an entire tour undefeated.

results.title: The Invertebrates
results.brief_description: Defines invertebrates and shows examples of protozoa, sponges, coelenterates, worms, echinoderms, molluscs and arthropods. Suggests key descriptive words to use in remembering characteristics of each group. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Invention of the adolescent (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Guy Glover, Cecily Burwash and Patricia Watson
results.brief_description: From the past, when distinctions between childhood and adulthood were not as finely drawn as they are today, this film traces the development of the adolescent and shows some of the real problems of this age. It notes that it was the defense of the young, the protection afforded by reformers and educators, that created the generation gap so evident today in Western society. What adolescents gained and lost from changing attitudes towards them is clearly illustrated in the film. (Awards: New York; La Plata; Tehran)
